modularisation

Class RedundancyReportGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • modularisation.RedundancyReportGenerator

  • public class RedundancyReportGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    The RedundancyReportGenerator checks for redundancy (duplicate classes) in a set of modules. If there are duplicates, these are printed to screen and an alignment file including those duplicates is stored to "alignmentFolderName".
    Author:
    audunvennesland Feb 8, 2018

      • findDuplicates

        public static void findDuplicates(java.lang.String alignmentFolderName,
                                  java.lang.String ontologyModuleDir)
                           throws org.semanticweb.owl.align.AlignmentException,
                                  java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                  java.io.IOException
        Finds duplicate classes in a set of modules.
        Parameters:
        alignmentFolderName - The folder to which alignments holding duplicate classes are stored in.
        ontologyModuleDir - The folder holding modules to be checked for redundancy (duplicate classes)

        org.semanticweb.owl.align.AlignmentException
